Introduction to Esports
Module 3: Expanding Career and College Opportunities

Career Opportunities

Esports is a relatively new field offering a wide variety of careers that is growing exponentially each year, as indicated by the graph below. The video game industry has already passed the movie, television, and music industries as the biggest entertainment industry on the planet, and shows no signs of slowing.

From a landscape report from NewZoo (link), the video game industry will rise to over $200 billion in 2022-23. This industry is larger than music, television & film industries combined. The number of video game downloads/purchases, people playing games, and revenue generated from esports events, will all continue to rise over the next few years. Live-streaming esports will rise as well with an expected audience of 1.4 billion consumers by 2025. With such a large industry, video games will provide opportunities related to careers, education, and entertainment sectors. Knowing the global impact of this industry, how can schools leverage the popularity to provide safe, educational, career pathways and skills-focused opportunities for students?

In addition to developing important skills that can help students succeed in just about anything they do, esports itself is a fast-growing industry that offers many job opportunities beyond being a pro player. These include careers related to production, programming, streaming, management of esports teams, game development, graphic design, marketing, video production, and even STEM fields, as previously mentioned in this course. When there is esports in schools, students can learn about a wide array of career opportunities.
